meanings.definition: The action or process of reinventing something.
meanings.sent1: Her reinvention of the traditional recipe brought a fresh taste to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The company's reinvention of their logo gave it a more modern look.
meanings.sent3: His reinvention of the classic fairy tale had everyone laughing at the unexpected twists.
meanings.sent4: The artist's reinvention of the landscape painting was truly groundbreaking.
meanings.sent5: Through reinvention, she transformed the old into something entirely new and exciting.

meanings.definition: The act of changing something so much that it appears to be entirely new.
meanings.sent1: The magician's reinvention of the card trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer's reinvention of the dress style made it a trendsetter.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's reinvention of the knock-knock joke had everyone giggling uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The chef's reinvention of the classic dessert was a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent5: With reinvention, the old became unrecognizable, transformed into something fresh and exciting.

meanings.definition: The process of making changes in order to improve or modernize something.
meanings.sent1: The reinvention of the school curriculum led to better student engagement.
meanings.sent2: The reinvention of the city's transportation system made commuting more efficient.
meanings.sent3: The reinvention of the old building into a modern office space was a huge success.
meanings.sent4: The reinvention of the traditional dance brought a new energy to the performance.
meanings.sent5: Through reinvention, the outdated became cutting-edge, adapting to the changing times.
